business.headline: Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after Wall Street closed at a record high?The US market closed at a record high as fresh data from the United States eased concerns about an economic slowdown in the world's largest economy.

Starbucks CEO ditches 1,600 km commute, buys house near workWhen Niccol was appointed as Starbucks CEO in August last year, the company agreed to a special travel plan. He was allowed to commute between California and Seattle using a corporate jet, as long as he worked from the Seattle office at least three days a week.

Walmart cuts hundreds of roles to streamline operations: ReportEarlier this year, Walmart announced about 1,500 job cuts, which hit teams in its global tech division, online order fulfilment in US stores and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.
Sensex ends 375 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 375.24 points to close at 82,259.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.60 points to end at 25,111.45.
Dalal Street not Asia's darling anymore, says BofA surveyThe latest survey by Bank of America (BofA), shows that investor interest in Indian stock market has dropped in recent months.

How safe are India's instant loan appsFrom students low on fees to families with sudden hospital bills, many use instant loan apps for fast cash, some promise money in 10–30 minutes using just a phone and a few documents.

Sebi looks to extend tenure of derivatives contracts, says officialSebi is signalling a shift toward deeper, more stable markets by discouraging speculative short-term trades and pushing for longer-tenure contracts, amid growing retail losses and extreme derivatives dominance.

Is Thane outshining Mumbai real estate with cheaper housing?Most new homes coming up in Thane are either 1BHK or 2BHK units. About 45% of new supply from 2020 to 2025 was 2BHKs, while 42% was 1BHKs. Larger homes like 3BHKs and 4BHKs together make up only around 13% of the new supply.

Personal loan rates 2025: How much are SBI, ICICI and others charging?Many banks in India have updated their personal loan interest rates for 2025. Most banks are offering rates starting from about 9.50% per year and going up to 10.50% for some customers, depending on their credit score and repayment ability.

TCS benching policy sparks fear among employees after first cycle: ReportThe policy, introduced on June 12, limits the time employees can remain without project work to just 35 days. After this, they face the risk of losing out on promotions or even losing their jobs.

New UPI rules: What happens if payments fail now?Earlier, if someone raised a chargeback, say, when money was deducted, but they did not get what they paid for, and it got declined, the bank had to go through an extra step.

Parliament panel proposes revival of key tax relief for companies: ReportThe government is set to restore Section 80M in the new Income Tax Bill, easing dividend tax burdens for companies. The bill is likely to pass in the Monsoon Session.

entertainment.headline: Tanvi The Great review: Soulful acting bogged down by uneven pacing, flat executionRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Tanvi The Great Review: 'Tanvi: The Great' marks the acting debut of Shubhangi Dutt. Despite its ambitious emotional arc, the Anupam Kher-directorial drifts from its promising premise.

Special Ops 2 review: Kay Kay Menon anchors ambitious but uneven spy thrillerRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Special Ops 2 series review: The second season of 'Special Ops' delves into AI-driven cyber warfare intertwined with classic spy drama. The season raises questions about technology's role in future conflicts and personal sacrifices.

Veteran Tamil director-cinematographer Velu Prabhakaran dies at 68 in ChennaiPopular Tamil director and cinematographer Velu Prabhakaran died on Friday morning at a private hospital in Chennai. According to reports, he died due to prolonged illness.

Munawar Faruqui learnt timeliness from Kangana Ranaut, being late from Salman KhanDuring a press conference on Thursday, actor-comedian Munawar Faruqui spoke about his upcoming reality show 'The Society'. He also shared what he learned from actors Kangana Ranaut and Salman Khan.

Thalaivan Thalaivii trailer: Romance meets chaos in Vijay Sethupathi, Nithya's filmThe trailer for 'Thalaivan Thalaivii' featuring Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen has been released, showcasing a unique love story. Anticipation builds as the film is set to release on July 25.

Chris Martin exposes office romance at Coldplay concert, leaves couple mortifiedColdplay's frontman Chris Martin unintentionally exposed a couple's affair during a concert in Boston, leading to a viral moment filled with humour and audience laughter. This incident happened amid the band's record-breaking Music of the Spheres World Tour, which continues to draw huge crowds across the US and beyond.

Namit Malhotra says Hans Zimmer called Ramayana beyond time and human imagination'Ramayana' producer Namit Malhotra recently opened up on his discussion with Oscar-winning composer Hans Zimmer. He praised Zimmer for his understanding of the ancient Indian epic.

Ajay Devgn and Son of Sardaar 2 cast bring sarcasm to Kapil Sharma's showActors Ajay Devgn, Mrunal Thakur, and Ravi Kishan will feature in the upcoming episode of 'The Great Indian Kapil Sharma Show' season 3. The promo shows Devgn playfully roasting the host and Navjot Singh Sidhu. The episode will air on July 19 on Netflix.

Sidharth-Kiara request no photos, only blessings for baby girl, gift sweets to mediaSidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani requested the paparazzi to respect their privacy and avoid clicking their newborn daughter. The couple welcomed a baby girl earlier this week.

Vijay Deverakonda hospitalised with dengue ahead of Kingdom release on July 31Actor Vijay Deverakonda has been hospitalised after being diagnosed with dengue. The actor, whose film 'Kingdom' is scheduled for release on July 31, is expected to be discharged in a couple of days.

Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendNetflix's new weekend lineup caters to all tastes, featuring a mix of documentaries, anime, dramas, and comedy shows. From thought-provoking political documentaries to thrilling action and heartfelt stories, there is something engaging for every viewer in India.

ASIA review: A breathtaking love letter to the wild heart of the continentRelease Date:Thu Jul 17, 2025Filmed over four years across the continent's most extreme terrains, 'Asia' is a beautiful wildlife series. With narration by Sir David Attenborough and music by SEVENTEEN, the BBC series is both visually stunning and emotionally resonant, taking you from the Himalayan red panda to highway-raiding elephants in Sri Lanka.

The Po Po Song: Ajay Devgn, Guru Randhawa bring back nostalgia in Son of Sardaar 2The makers of the much-awaited film 'Son of Sardaar 2' released 'The Po Po Song' on Thursday. For the song, actor Ajay Devgn collaborated with singer Guru Randhawa for the first time.

Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendA host of new films and shows will be available for streaming this weekend on Prime Video. These include Dhanush's 'Kuberaa', season 3 of Lola Tung's 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' and Judy Sheindlin's 'Justice on Trial'.

German film Brick might be the most thrilling thing to watch on OTT this weekendThe German thriller 'Brick' is trending at number 2 on Netflix's list of top movies in India. The film features actors Matthias Schweighofer and Ruby O. Fee in the lead roles. It is psychological and dystopian, but is it worth a watch? Let's find out.

The Summer I Turned Pretty? More like the summer my best friend backstabbed meWhen your best friend starts acting more like a life coach and less like a friend, it's time to take a step back. Here's how 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' is showing us signs that your friend might not always know what's best for you.

Ibrahim Ali Khan offers a glimpse into his intense training for SarzameenIbrahim Ali Khan will be seen in an intense role in 'Sarzameen', where he plays the son of Prithviraj and Kajol who turns into a terrorist. Before the film's release on July 25 on JioHotstar, he shared behind-the-scenes photos and training glimpses.

Pretty Little Baby singer Connie Francis dies at 87Legendary 1960s pop singer Connie Francis, known for hits like the viral 'Pretty Little Baby', died at the age of 87. She was the first solo female artiste to top the Billboard Hot 100.

Janaki V vs State of Kerala review: Noble intentions marred by flawed executionRelease Date:Thu Jul 17, 2025Janaki V vs State of Kerala movie review: Written and directed by Pravin Narayanan, the Malayalam suspense drama film stars Suresh Gopi and Anupama Parameshwaran in the lead.

general news.headline: US declares Lashkar offshoot behind Pahalgam attack as terror organisationThe United States has designated The Resistance Front (TRF) as a Foreign Terrorist Organization for its involvement in the Pahalgam attack in Kashmir, which killed 26 civilians.

Siddaramaiah 'killed' by Meta, translation blunder gets Chief Minister's goatThe post, originally written in Kannada to mourn the death of veteran actor B Saroja Devi, was mistranslated into English, prompting sharp criticism from Siddaramaiah.

Pak channels withdraw reports on Trump's visit after White House clears airThe White House and Pakistan's Foreign Office denied any such plans, calling the reports unverified. Trump is instead scheduled to visit the UK in September.

Hum honge kamyaab: Kunal Kamra's satirical dig at Maharashtra Assembly brawlIn a satirical video set to his offbeat rendition of Hum Honge Kamyaab, Kunal Kamra stitched together dramatic clips of the brawl between BJP and NCP (Sharad Pawar faction) supporters - then slipped in shots of Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, making his dig at the Mahayuti alliance unmistakably clear.

Special Ops 2 review: Kay Kay Menon anchors ambitious but uneven spy thrillerRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Special Ops 2 series review: The second season of 'Special Ops' delves into AI-driven cyber warfare intertwined with classic spy drama. The season raises questions about technology's role in future conflicts and personal sacrifices.

Justice Yashwant Varma approaches top court over impeachment in cash haul caseJustice Yashwant Varma claimed that the proceedings violated his rights both as an individual and as a constitutional functionary and the enquiry committee concluded its proceedings without investigating key facts.

Trump diagnosed with vein condition after photos of swollen ankles spark concernThe White House said Donald Trump was found to be suffering from chronic venous insufficiency after the President underwent a check-up on noticing 'mild swelling' in his ankles.

More than 20 Delhi schools get bomb threats. 30 such incidents this weekAmong the schools that received threatening emails were Richmondd Global School in Paschim Vihar and Abhinav Public School, located in Rohini Sector 3.
How Air India can give its revival plan wingThe Ahmedabad crash has cast a long shadow over the airline, exposing cracks in safety, staffing and systems and posing the challenge of rebuilding trust
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Unverified: Probe body rejects US media report on 'pilot's role' in Air India crashThe AAIB slammed The Wall Street Journal over its report highlighting a pilot's role in the Air India Flight 171 crash on June 12 in Ahmedabad, calling it unverified and saying it was too early to come to conclusions.

'Traitor' tag for Mir Jafar, Tipu Sultan missing: Controversy erupts over NCERT changesRecent changes in NCERT's new Class 8 history textbook have stirred controversy over the portrayal of key historical figures. While Mir Jafar is now explicitly labelled a "traitor," mentions of Tipu Sultan and Haider Ali have been removed, triggering a debate on selective representation and historical accuracy.

He was allowed to commute between California and Seattle using a corporate jet, as long as he worked from the Seattle office at least three days a week.

ED aa gayi: Bhupesh Baghel on raids at home over liquor 'scam' case against sonThe ED has claimed that Chaitanya Baghel is among those who received proceeds of crime as part of a parallel liquor network that allegedly siphoned off Rs 2,161 crore during Bhupesh Baghel's tenure as Chhattisgarh Chief Minister.

Trump threatens to sue WSJ for publishing his 'erotic letter' to EpsteinUS President Donald Trump has threatened to sue The Wall Street Journal over its report on a lewd letter he allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003, calling the story fake and defamatory.

Can't believe he killed himself before...: Musk taunts Trump over Epstein filesElon Musk mocked President Donald Trump over the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case. While the White House confirmed that Trump won't appoint a special prosecutor to investigate the Epstein case further.

Mohammed Siraj is like a lion, important to manage his workload: Assistant coachIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate on Thursday hailed fast bowler Mohammed Siraj's lion-hearted commitment to the team's cause, stressing the importance of managing his workload to preserve his fitness and impact in the long run.

Why can't same-sex partner be medical proxy: Court asks government, medical bodyThe court was hearing a plea filed by Arshiya, a Delhi-based businesswoman. She married her partner, also a woman, in New Zealand in 2023. Both are Indian citizens living in Delhi.

Has Karun Nair exhausted all his chances in England? Assistant coach revealsIndia's assistant coach Ryan Ten Doeschate has shared his views on Karun Nair's form in the ongoing series against England. Nair has failed to convert his starts into big scores in the series so far, which has affected India badly.

Why the love genre comes naturally to film director Vivek SoniHis latest offering, 'Aap Jaisa Koi', starring R. Madhavan and Fatima Sana Shaikh, has been trending at #1 on the Netflix India Top 10 since release

How your breakfast can help you reduce bloatingYour breakfast may be the reason you have been feeling bloated all day. To tackle that, all you need is a few lifestyle changes and of course, homemade food.

Ons Jabeur announces break from tennis to rediscover joy of living, thanks fansOns Jabeur announces a break from professional tennis to prioritise her mental and physical health. Her decision highlights the importance of self-care amid challenging times in elite sport.

Imran Khan's sister summoned after remarks against Pak Army Chief Asim MunirImran Khan's sister Aleema Khan was summoned by Pakistan's cybercrime agency after she blamed Army Chief Asim Munir if anything happened to her jailed brother.

Chhangur Baba case: ED finds Croatian currency photo on associate's phoneThe Enforcement Directorate uncovers potential international links in Chhangur Baba's conversion racket, with discoveries pointing to the use of foreign currency in operations.

Snoop Dogg becomes co-owner of Swansea City, joins Modric in ownership groupRapper Snoop Dogg has joined Swansea City as a co-owner and investor, acquiring a minority stake in the Championship club. Swansea launched their home kit for the 2025-26 season last weekend.

ENG vs IND: Is Liam Dawson a smart pick for England for Manchester Test?England vs India, Manchester Test: England have drafted Liam Dawson in as a replacement for the injured Shoaib Bashir - but will the move pay off as they look to seal the series in Manchester?

Smriti Mandhana celebrates 29th birthday: Top 10 records held by India batterIndian women's cricket star Smriti Mandhana turned 29 on July 18. Since her debut in 2013, the elegant left-hander has etched her name in the record books, playing a pivotal role in the rise and growing popularity of women's cricket in India.

Durand Cup 2025: ISL presence halved, Manipur joins as new co-hostThe 2025 Durand Cup sees a sharp drop in ISL participation as just six top-tier teams sign up. Manipur debuts as a host amid uncertainty surrounding the AIFF-FSDL standoff and ISL's future.

Ten Doeschate points out major concern for India before 4th TestENG vs IND, 4th Test: Speaking to the reporters before the Manchester Test, India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said that losing wickets in clusters haven't helped India in the ongoing Test series against England.

Liverpool agree personal terms with Ekitike, wait on Isak stance: ReportsPremier League: Liverpool have shifted focus to Hugo Ekitike after Newcastle refused to part with Alexander Isak. With a verbal agreement in place, the Reds are pushing to seal a £70m+ deal before the transfer window closes.

Max Verstappen to Mercedes? Meeting with Toto Wolff fuels Red Bull exit rumoursRumours of Max Verstappen's exit from Red Bull are gaining traction after reports of a secret meeting with Mercedes boss Toto Wolff. This move could potentially shock the F1 world.

Bumrah vs Stokes: Ten Doeschate shuts down workload comparison talksENG vs IND: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate addressed the discussion around the workloads of England captain Ben Stokes and Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah following the Lord's Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
